Solar Power Systems

Reduce electricity costs and consumption of grid energy while operating in a more sustainable way by leveraging our state-of-the-art, custom-designed public sector and commercial solar power systems.

Jump to: Benefits | Case studies | How it works | Why choose us | Resources | Blogs

Solar power is a renewable energy source that works by absorbing sunlight and converting it into electricity. Installing solar photovoltaic (PV) solutions enables organizations to generate their own efficient energy supply on-site instead of drawing more expensive energy from the grid – the power can be used directly on-site or fed back into the grid to create an additional revenue stream.

Solar energy companies like Centrica Business Solutions can help your organization harness this 100% sustainable, reliable, and cost-effective energy to power your operations. We help organizations unlock value from existing site infrastructure like their roof, parking lot, or ground space – by installing public sector and commercial solar power systems to transform existing space into sources of on-site renewable energy generation. Every solar power system is custom-designed and engineered to your specific site, needs, and energy goals in order to maximize energy production and deliver energy savings.

Offset grid energy with renewable energy

Learn how public sector and commercial solar power systems help your organization with energy cost control and sustainability efforts.

Watch our video to see how solar power systems enable you to take control of your operating costs while reducing your carbon footprint by generating cost-efficient, 100% renewable energy on-site.

Benefits of solar power systems

Lower your electricity costs and reduce your consumption from the grid by generating your own renewable electricity.

Reduce your carbon footprint, meet sustainability goals, and strengthen environmental and corporate social responsibility credentials by offsetting grid consumption with renewable energy.

Gain budget stability through predictable electricity costs and accurate forecasting of operating expenses.

Free up cash flow to reinvest into your organization or support local goals.

Generate revenue by selling excess renewable energy to the grid through programs like net metering.

Monetize existing infrastructure by transforming your roof, ground space, or parking lot into a source of on-site renewable energy generation.
